intro: Notopleura guadalupensis subsp. venezuelica, commonly known as the Venezuelan notopleura, is a perennial shrub native to the Andean regions of Venezuela. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and clusters of small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky slopes. Its botanical features include a woody stem, alternate leaves with prominent veins, and a short flowering period during the spring. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and limited distribution.
